headline.main: Binge Eating Among Men Steps Out of the Shadows

docs.abstract: Research indicates that binge eating disorder, which affects about eight million Americans, is about as common in men as in women; while treatment focuses mainly on women, the perils of the disorder are perhaps greater for men, who rarely seek help for what is many believe is a 'women's disease'. Photo (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: After downing 70 chicken wings in about an hour, Andrew Walen realized he had a problem.Oh, he had known something was wrong over the years. Normal people don't consume 4,500 calories worth of food in one sitting, or order takeout for four when dining alone. But it took a maniacal feeding frenzy for him to finally accept the reality: He was a binge eater, and he had absolutely no control around food.

headline.seo: Study Links Healthy Weight in Children With Tough Snack Laws
headline.print_headline: Study Links Healthier Weight in Children With Strict Laws on School Snacks
headline.main: Study Links Healthier Weight in Children With Strict Laws on School Snacks

docs.abstract: Study published in journal Pediatrics finds a strong link between lower rates of adolescent obesity and strict laws regulating the sale of snacks and sugary drinks in public schools; conducted over three years in 40 states, study is likely to stoke the debate over government efforts to reduce obesity rates.
docs.lead_paragraph: The study, conducted over three years in 40 states, is likely to stoke the debate over government efforts to reduce obesity rates.
docs.snippet: The study, conducted over three years in 40 states, is likely to stoke the debate over government efforts to reduce obesity rates.

headline.main: Study Links Healthier Weight in Children With Strict Laws on School Snacks

docs.abstract: Study published in journal Adolescence finds a strong link between lower rates of adolescent obesity and strict laws regulating the sale of snacks and sugary drinks in public schools; conducted over three years in 40 states, study is likely to stoke the debate over government efforts to reduce obesity rates. (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Adolescents in states with strict laws regulating the sale of snacks and sugary drinks in public schools gained less weight over a three-year period than those living in states with no such laws, a new study has found.The study, published Monday in Pediatrics, found a strong association between healthier weight and tough state laws regulating food in vending machines, snack bars and other venues that were not part of the regular school meal programs. Such snacks and drinks are known as competitive foods, because they compete with school breakfasts and lunches.

docs.abstract: Mark Bittman Op-Ed column maintains murder is often preventable, through regulations, education and medical intervention; calls for making gun purchases more difficult, especially for people with mental disabilities. (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Back in the administration of W., we looked for the weapons of mass destruction in Iraq. That was the wrong place; they're here at home. Normally the W.M.D. I write about is the Standard American Diet (yes: SAD); occasionally I talk about food safety, or climate change, or related topics. But no matter what you look at, the basic problem remains so-called leadership that cannot stand up to big ag, big food, big energy, Wall Street ...or the N.R.A.Since 9/11, 33 Americans have been killed by ''terrorists'' ; roughly 150,000 Americans have been killed by non-terrorists: that is, your run-of-the-mill murderers. Murder, like the leading cause of death -- heart disease -- is often preventable, through regulations, education and medical intervention.
